intro: Wettsteinia nidulans, commonly known as the desert holly, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, yellowish-green flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with thick, waxy leaves that reduce water loss. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Wettsteinia nidulans is often found in rocky soils and is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
